lexUnit.definition: FN: ignite something. "Alan gathered sticks and lit a fire."

sentence.text: A request to light a memorial candle -- his family is Jewish -- was met with blank and insensitive refusal .
It reinforced his uneasiness , however , when she lit candles on the small dining-table and then turned off the only overhead electric light .
She put on her robe , lit the candle and went on tip-toe down the back stairs and into the kitchen .
Then we lit the candles and read the Visitors ' Book through from 1960 onwards .
I lit the candle inside the skull of Old Saul .
Someone had lit a torch , but its smoky , wavering light only emphasised the hopelessness of trying to pick out individuals in the seething turmoil .
The assistant lit torches at her head and feet , and the light from these outlined the contours of her dark skin .
As dark fell , street lights went on in the square and many demonstrators lit paper torches . "
But this could not be done without noise , especially the last , and hearing it the defenders lit first torches and then large beacons along the walls and opened up with their guns .
Dacourt , Clinton and the rest congregated in the main hall whilst servants lit torches and others brought ale or wine for the conquering heroes .
She let herself in and ministered to their needs , brewing a pot of tea and lighting a good fire .
She could smell the wood-smoke : someone had been trying to light a fire .
` It was your father , the Earl , who came up when they were already lighting the fire , " Simon 's voice said from behind her .
I would have lit the fire for you . "
As La Scala began to bitch , and Rome 's success began to burgeon , Cresci lit spectacular bonfires in the street in wonderfully designed fireplaces .
Mr Mann also urged that people lighting their bonfire should check for pets like the family tortoise and hedgehogs which may have hibernated there .
The beacon was lit , and answering bonfires spread the happy news throughout the Maclean lands .
Somebody had lit a bonfire and we sat round it chatting until we had dried our clothes .
They used the PhD to light a bonfire to barbecue some steaks they 'd nicked .
Holmes lit a match .
There was quiet while Foley lit a match and drew .
Police talked to the man for 90 minutes before breaking into the flat in Brighton and grabbing him after he threatened to light a match .
Every August young women convene to light joss sticks and some even climb the nine - meter ( 30 - ft ) rock to pray for good husbands .
" That , at least , is very easily settled , " said Holmes , lighting his little pocket lantern .
According to one official , the fire started when ten students lit a bonfire on a ridge but failed to extinguish it .
